basics.name: José Rodríguez Ortega
basics.label: Research Engineer, PhD in Data Learning

work.name: Software Nemotec
work.summary: Research Engineer at Software Nemotec, where I try to bridge the gap between research and industry in the field of Deep Learning in orthodontics.

work.name: LifeWatch-ERIC
work.position: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Assistant
work.summary: Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Assistant at LifeWatch-ERIC, where I work on the development of Deep Learning models for remote sensing data analysis.

publications.name: CHaRNet: Conditioned Heatmap Regression for Robust Dental Landmark Localization
publications.summary: Introduced CHaRNet, the first fully end-to-end deep learning framework for anatomical landmark detection in 3D dental models. CHaRNet operates directly on point clouds, bypassing tooth segmentation, and uses a novel Conditioned Heatmap Regression module to robustly handle missing teeth, achieving high accuracy and streamlining orthodontic workflows.

publications.name: Land use and land cover fraction estimation for Sentinel-2 RGB images: A new LULC mapping task
publications.publisher: Remote Sensing Applications: Society and Environment
publications.summary: Proposed a novel LULC fraction estimation task for public Sentinel-2 RGB images, predicting both the presence and fractional abundance of LULC classes. We introduced Land-1.0, the first open-source dataset of its kind, and developed multitask deep learning models that offer a scalable, cost-effective solution for environmental monitoring.

publications.name: Bidirectional recurrent imputation and abundance estimation of LULC classes with MODIS multispectral time series and geo-topographic and climatic data
publications.publisher: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
publications.summary: We present a novel deep learning approach for spectral unmixing of MODIS multispectral time series that addresses missing data through end-to-end bidirectional LSTM models. Our method integrates spectral-temporal data with geo-topographic and climatic information to estimate LULC abundances in mixed pixels without explicit endmember extraction. We created the Andalusia MultiSpectral MultiTemporal Unmixing dataset with monthly MODIS data at 460-m resolution, demonstrating significant improvements in LULC abundance estimation.

publications.name: CI-dataset and DetDSCI methodology for detecting too small and too large critical infrastructures in satellite images: airports and electrical substations as case study
publications.publisher: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
publications.summary: Proposed the CI-dataset and a novel DetDSCI methodology to detect critical infrastructures of varying scales, such as airports and electrical substations, in satellite imagery. The two-level, resolution-independent approach significantly improves detection, achieving up to a 37.53% F1 score improvement over standard models like Faster R-CNN.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
